result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Krista L Kordus

defendant.name: Kordus, Krista L
defendant.address: Party Address Sealed by Court Commissioner Herring

records.addlTxt:
10:36 AM Defendant Krista L Kordus in court.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Krista L Kordus.  Prosecuting attorney Lindsey Hirt in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense does not have an offer yet from the State. Defense has reviewed discovery. There is also a case pending mediation in Racine County. Defense asks for a status in November. 

Court quashes stayed capias. Defense explains that authorization had been received but not filed. 

State does not have a pre-trial offer, but will forward to charging DA.
Hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on November 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.

2:10 PM Attorney Cassandra Miller appears for attorney  Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Krista L Kordus.  Prosecuting attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Attorney Miller states that Atty Nimmer intended on filing an authorization to appear. Court notes it does not appear that one was filed yet. Attorney Miller requests another date in 45 days to review discovery. 
State requests a stayed capias. 
Court will order a stayed capias and set another date.
Hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on October 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

New conditions:  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim A & B/witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

1:08 PM Defendant Krista L Kordus in court.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Krista L Kordus. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by  Abigail Kincheloe.
Atty. Nimmer moves to modify the bond as the bail in another county has been modified.  State agrees to the modification.  Court modifies bail.  Next court date remains as previously set.
Bail/bond hearing on August 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Atty Amanda Nimmer

Motion to Modify Conditions of Bail.
**Reviewed by Commissioner David Herring on 08-12-2022. "Set for hearing"
Hearing on September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key. Signed by Judge Carter on 08/08/2022.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Victim B/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key with the exception of 3rd party contact through any State Agency pursuant to the parenting of her minor child.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

04:12 PM Defendant Krista L Kordus in court, in custody, with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Niki Kane appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  The Court orders the defendant's addressed to be sealed from CCAP and for the address to either be redacted from the Criminal Complaint or for the entire Criminal Complaint to be marked confidential.  Hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
WCS Pre-trial Report
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
